WorkItem.Description: when I freshly load my warlock from the armory it shows up with a hit rating of 388 in Rawr, while it only shows 348 in WoW. I ignored Rawr's recommendation and pushed hit rating to the current level. but with this mis-read from armory is suggest the  wrong stats, while hit rating is still below required levels. this needs to get fixed in order to make rawr's warlock recommendation accurate again.

Comments.Message: If you are having this kind of issue you need to post the character file AND the armory information so we can try to replicate the issue. The problem could simply be something you are doing wrong. A difference of 40 hit could easily mean Hit Food Buff is being applied.

Hi ! First, Im sorry for my bad english...

Ive go a similar problem. When I load my char from the armory, the statistics given do not match the IG statistics. There are some huge differences (650+ haste in Rawr, 426 IG). I checked my buffs, but the differences didnt come from there.

Here's my armory and the file : http://eu.wowarmory.com/character-sheet.xml?r=Archimonde&n=Kyrra

Oh ok. So the stats displayed include Unlished Rage and the 200 haste from the totem, admitting an average uptime of 100% ?

Is that right ?
In your case, yes, both trinkets, and your totem, will definitely apply the stats in Rawr, and not in-game.
Ok. Thanks a lot for the help :-)
